title: Route payment visitors directly to the owner’s Cash App payment page

requirements.text: Add a single source of truth for the Cash App payment destination so the app can send visitors directly to the owner’s Cash App payment page (not the generic Cash App homepage), and use English user-facing text that clearly states payments happen on Cash App (Boostly does not collect or store payments).

quotes: Don’t put them in my personal acc just take them to my Cash App where the can pay me

acceptanceCriteria: A configurable Cash App payment URL exists in the frontend codebase (similar in spirit to frontend/src/config/subscriptionLinks.ts).
The Cash App button opens the configured Cash App payment URL in a new tab with noopener/noreferrer, instead of opening https://cash.app/.
All user-facing copy in the payments section clearly communicates that Boostly only links out and does not process, collect, or store payments.
No user-facing text mentions routing money into a personal account within Boostly.

requirements.text: Update the Payments/Monetization UI to prioritize Cash App-only flow, so visitors are guided to pay via Cash App, using English user-facing text.

quotes: Don’t put them in my personal acc just take them to my Cash App where the can pay me

acceptanceCriteria: The Payments/Monetization section headline and supporting copy are updated to focus on Cash App as the payment destination.
The primary CTA in the Payments/Monetization section is the Cash App button.
If the Cash App URL is not configured, the Cash App button is disabled and an English setup/help message is shown (consistent with the existing subscription ‘link not set up’ pattern).

requirements.text: Update the existing payments FAQ entry to reflect the Cash App-only payment flow and to explicitly state that Boostly does not process payments and that payments are completed on Cash App.

quotes: Don’t put them in my personal acc just take them to my Cash App where the can pay me

acceptanceCriteria: frontend/src/content/siteContent.ts FAQ content is updated so the payment-related FAQ answer states visitors are taken to Cash App to pay and Boostly does not process/store payments.
All updated FAQ text is in English and matches the Cash App-only flow used in the Payments/Monetization section.

constraints: Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor (backend/main.mo); do not introduce additional canisters/services.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed in frontend.immutablePaths.
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Implementing in-app payment processing or storing payment methods inside Boostly.
Integrating third-party auth providers beyond Internet Identity.
Adding a new post-click confirmation page (not requested in the user’s last message).
